variable.name: SUBJID
variable.comment: T1DGC Analytic ID - an 8-digit identifer - or UNKNOWN-CASE-n. Unknown cases are where we are sure that the sample is not as intended (by concordance with previous genotype data) but the sample will have come from the same case panel DNA boxes. These 5 subjects will have most other phenotype data missing.

variable.name: case_control
variable.comment: This distribution is for the case part of the T1DGC Illumina GWAS 2008 experiment. Control data submitted to http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ega/.

variable.name: sex
variable.comment: Sex is as verified by genotyping.

variable.name: approx_year_of_birth
variable.comment: Year of birth is estimated from age at bleed, so is accurate to within 2 years.

variable.name: b58cregion
variable.comment: Region is broad place of recruitment, as defined by the 1958 Birth Cohort (our control group), and is not place of birth or current address. An additional pair of files - region-codes.tab and postcodes-regions-map.tab - relates regions to counties and postcodes (zipcodes).

variable.name: caucasian
variable.comment: Due to very limited number of non-white-British subjects presenting with T1D, this was reduced to a simple caucasian yes/no variable, and used as an exclusion criterion. Further testing was done comparing Ancestry Informative Markers (AIMs) in the GWAS data againt CEPH subjects, and some exclusions are recorded in the t1dgc_outcome variable.

variable.name: mody
variable.description: Mature Onset Diabetes of the Young (MODY) status - a monogenic disorder
variable.comment: MODY is an exclusion criterion. There is no missing value.

variable.name: niddk_cl
variable.comment: The intention is to send all genomic DNA samples to the NIDDK sample repository - here we report cell line samples sent up to 2009-02-13.

variable.name: onset
variable.description: Age at onset (and diagnosis) of T1D
variable.comment: Recorded to 2 decimal places if age-at-onset < 2, else as an integer. Age of onset < 0.50 is an exclusion criterion (as may be confused with PNDM), as is age of onset > 16 (as may be confused with T2D).

variable.name: sample_type
variable.comment: For this experiment we intended to use cell-lined samples only.

variable.name: pndm
variable.comment: Age of onset < 0.50 is defined (by us) as PNDM, and is an exclusion criterion. There is no missing value.

variable.name: t1dgc_status
variable.comment: The values are rather terse strings. Subjects with 1==included, or ==unintended should be left in an analysis, everyone else should be excluded.
variable.value: Sample contaminated (a verdict from Illumina) - exclude
Excluded on the basis of calculated lack of similarity to CEPH subjects
Excluded on the basis of (first degree?) relatedness to another member of the study, case or control
Excluded for both AIMs and relatedness
Sample failed (a verdict from Illumina) - exclude
Subject included by mistake - e.g. aliquoting error - but still useable

variable.name: t2d
variable.comment: As age of onset increases it requires auto-antibody measures to confirm an autoimmune disorder. Age of onset > 16 is an exclusion criterion to avoid having to test for auto-antibodies. There is no missing value.

variable.name: wtccc_status
variable.comment: There should have been no overlap between the subjects in this experiment and the Wellcome Trust Case Control Consortium. WTCCC data is available from http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ega/.
variable.value: Missing (i.e. had no part in earlier study)
Included in earlier study by mistake
Included in earlier study purposefully (i.e. mistake here)
